Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Thomas Wilson', 'Millie Wood', 'Mia Williams', 'Phoebe Young', 'Michael Wood']
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Thomas Wilson just arrived.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Millie Wood -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Millie Wood just arrived.
    Millie Wood -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Mia Williams -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Mia Williams just arrived.
    Mia Williams -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Phoebe Young -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.
    Phoebe Young -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Michael Wood just arrived.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Mia Williams -- Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
    Event statement
  • Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Mia Williams's attempted action: Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
    Active player
  • Mia Williams
      Name
    • Mia Williams
      Action attempt
    • Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer
          State
        • Mia Williams is a complex and intriguing individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Mia Williams:
          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 16 years old, she watched from the periphery as Thomas, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael enthusiastically planned a weekend trip to the beach. Their excitement felt alien to her, their optimism a grating dissonance against her own world-weary cynicism. She feigned disinterest, muttering something about homework and burying herself in a book, secretly relieved to have an excuse to avoid their youthful exuberance.
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 20 years old, she found herself at The Queen's Arms with her friends, the air thick with the smell of beer and frying food. As Thomas regaled them with a story, his animated gestures drawing laughter from the others, Mia felt a familiar pang of detachment. She observed the scene with a detached amusement, noting the way the afternoon sunlight glinted off the beer glasses and the way Michael absentmindedly twirled a strand of Millie's hair. Their happiness felt like a performance, a carefully constructed facade that she couldn't bring herself to participate in.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams is 26 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Mia Williams has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Mia Williams goals is to have a good time. Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Mia Williams just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a cynical observer who prefers to watch the world from a distance.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a sense of cautious optimism.
          current daily occupation: likely working a job to support herself, as she is a member of the working class.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a complex and intriguing individual.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 11:00] Explore Shoreditch street art with friends, snapping photos and commenting on the murals.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Head to The Queen's Arms, settle into a comfortable spot, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere.
          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.
          Chain of thought
        • Mia Williams's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer:

          Mia Williams's
          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Mia Williams would likely observe her surroundings with a detached amusement, taking in the details of the street art and the energy of the crowd.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Mia Williams just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Mia Williams just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Mia Williams recently arrived in Shoreditch where she and her friends are enjoying the street art and planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland football game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently in a social situation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of Shoreditch and preparing to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Mia Williams just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Mia Williams recently arrived in Shoreditch where she and her friends are enjoying the street art and planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland football game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Mia Williams goals is to have a good time. Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Mia Williams has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a complex and intriguing individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently in a social situation with her friends, enjoying the atmosphere of Shoreditch and preparing to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely observe her surroundings with a detached amusement, taking in the details of the street art and the energy of the crowd.

          Plan: [10:15 - 11:00] Explore Shoreditch street art with friends, snapping photos and commenting on the murals.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Head to The Queen's Arms, settle into a comfortable spot, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere.
          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Mia Williams likely to say next? Respond in the format `Mia Williams -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?

      • What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Mia Williams would likely observe her surroundings with a detached amusement, taking in the details of the street art and the energy of the crowd.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Mia Williams:
          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 16 years old, she watched from the periphery as Thomas, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael enthusiastically planned a weekend trip to the beach. Their excitement felt alien to her, their optimism a grating dissonance against her own world-weary cynicism. She feigned disinterest, muttering something about homework and burying herself in a book, secretly relieved to have an excuse to avoid their youthful exuberance.
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 20 years old, she found herself at The Queen's Arms with her friends, the air thick with the smell of beer and frying food. As Thomas regaled them with a story, his animated gestures drawing laughter from the others, Mia felt a familiar pang of detachment. She observed the scene with a detached amusement, noting the way the afternoon sunlight glinted off the beer glasses and the way Michael absentmindedly twirled a strand of Millie's hair. Their happiness felt like a performance, a carefully constructed facade that she couldn't bring herself to participate in.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?


      Michael Wood's attempted action: Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [17 Aug 1989 00:00:00]
          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16 years old, he orchestrated a plan to rig the school election, ensuring his friend, Thomas Wilson, won the coveted position of student body president. Michael saw Thomas's earnest desire for the position as an opportunity to gain influence over the student body, pulling strings from behind the scenes. The victory, while technically Thomas's, was a testament to Michael's calculated machinations.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a history of manipulating situations to his advantage.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood is exploring Shoreditch with friends and is excited about an upcoming soccer game between Gibraltar and Ireland.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in Shoreditch with friends, exploring street art and about to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while maintaining a facade of going along with the group's decision.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Michael Wood would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while maintaining a facade of going along with the group's decision.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [17 Aug 1989 00:00:00]
          [17 Aug 1993 00:00:00] When Michael Wood was 16 years old, he orchestrated a plan to rig the school election, ensuring his friend, Thomas Wilson, won the coveted position of student body president. Michael saw Thomas's earnest desire for the position as an opportunity to gain influence over the student body, pulling strings from behind the scenes. The victory, while technically Thomas's, was a testament to Michael's calculated machinations.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex individual with a history of manipulating situations to his advantage.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in Shoreditch with friends, exploring street art and about to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while maintaining a facade of going along with the group's decision.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Phoebe Young -- Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
    Event statement
  • Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [06 Nov 1988 00:00:00]
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 16, she attended a school dance with her friends Mia, Thomas, Millie, and Michael. She spent the evening flitting from group to group, mimicking their interests and laughter, desperate to be accepted. By the end of the night, she felt utterly exhausted, realizing she hadn't actually connected with anyone on a genuine level.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, emphasizing its welcoming atmosphere and good beer selection.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Agree with whatever the group decides, even if it's not her first choice.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Arrive at the chosen pub, order a drink, and engage in light conversation with her friends.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the game, cheering enthusiastically alongside her friends.
          [14:00 - 15:00] Suggest grabbing a bite to eat after the game, again, focusing on a place that everyone would enjoy.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Phoebe Young is exploring Shoreditch with friends and is planning to watch a European football cup game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social situation with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely try to please her friends and fit in.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, emphasizing its welcoming atmosphere and good beer selection.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Agree with whatever the group decides, even if it's not her first choice.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Arrive at the chosen pub, order a drink, and engage in light conversation with her friends.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the game, cheering enthusiastically alongside her friends.
          [14:00 - 15:00] Suggest grabbing a bite to eat after the game, again, focusing on a place that everyone would enjoy.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Phoebe Young likely to say next? Respond in the format `Phoebe Young -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?

        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [06 Nov 1988 00:00:00]
          [06 Nov 1992 00:00:00] When Phoebe Young was 16, she attended a school dance with her friends Mia, Thomas, Millie, and Michael. She spent the evening flitting from group to group, mimicking their interests and laughter, desperate to be accepted. By the end of the night, she felt utterly exhausted, realizing she hadn't actually connected with anyone on a genuine level.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Millie Wood -- Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
    Event statement
  • Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?

          Answer
          State
        • Millie Wood is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [28 Dec 1981 00:00:00]
          [28 Dec 1985 00:00:00] When Millie Wood was 16, she stormed out of her English class after a particularly condescending remark from her teacher about the proper way to analyze Shakespeare. She marched straight to The Clapton Hart, where Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe were already gathered, and launched into a passionate defense of her own interpretation, her voice shaking with indignation. The bar staff, used to Millies fiery outbursts, simply smiled and slid her a plate of their famous jerk chicken, knowing it would calm her down as effectively as any lecture.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:

          [28 Dec 1985 00:00:00] When Millie Wood was 16, she stormed out of her English class after a particularly condescending remark from her teacher about the proper way to analyze Shakespeare. She marched straight to The Clapton Hart, where Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe were already gathered, and launched into a passionate defense of her own interpretation, her voice shaking with indignation. The bar staff, used to Millies fiery outbursts, simply smiled and slid her a plate of their famous jerk chicken, knowing it would calm her down as effectively as any lecture.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [28 Dec 1981 00:00:00]
          [28 Dec 1985 00:00:00] When Millie Wood was 16, she stormed out of her English class after a particularly condescending remark from her teacher about the proper way to analyze Shakespeare. She marched straight to The Clapton Hart, where Mia, Thomas, and Phoebe were already gathered, and launched into a passionate defense of her own interpretation, her voice shaking with indignation. The bar staff, used to Millies fiery outbursts, simply smiled and slid her a plate of their famous jerk chicken, knowing it would calm her down as effectively as any lecture.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: Millie Wood is exploring Shoreditch with her friends, admiring the street art and deciding where to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland football game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely advocate for her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while remaining open to considering other options suggested by her friends.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Persuade the group to go to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing the great Guinness and the fun atmosphere.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Walk with the group to The Clapton Hart, enjoying the street art and banter along the way.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Secure a table at The Clapton Hart, order drinks, and settle in for the game.
          [11:30 - 13:30] Cheer on Gibraltar and Ireland, enjoying the camaraderie and the pub atmosphere.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Millie Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Millie Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub.

          Answer: Millie Wood is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?

        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.


      Thomas Wilson's attempted action: Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Thomas Wilson:
          [07 Oct 1998 00:00:00] When Thomas Wilson was 16, he convinced his entire class that he had a summer job working on a top-secret government project. He embellished tales of classified documents and high-tech gadgets, leaving his classmates wide-eyed with awe. In reality, he spent his summer working at his uncle's hardware store, but the attention and admiration he received fueled his desire to create elaborate narratives.
          [07 Oct 2002 00:00:00] When Thomas Wilson was 20, he organized a massive themed party at The Clapton Hart, claiming it was his birthday celebration. He invited Mia, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael, along with dozens of other acquaintances, carefully crafting a persona of popularity and social prowess. The party was a roaring success, but Thomas knew deep down that it was all a carefully constructed facade, a way to mask his insecurities and longing for genuine connection.

          Statements:

He invited Mia, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael, along with dozens of other acquaintances, carefully crafting a persona of popularity and social prowess. The party was a roaring success, but Thomas knew deep down that it was all a carefully constructed facade, a way to mask his insecurities and longing for genuine connection.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game, emphasizing its great atmosphere and Guinness. He could also agree with Michael Wood's suggestion or try to steer the group towards The Clapton Hart by highlighting its positive attributes.

          Question: Of the options available to Thomas Wilson, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Thomas Wilson to take right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to directly suggest going to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing its great atmosphere and Guinness.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Thomas Wilson likely to say next? Respond in the format `Thomas Wilson -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.

  • Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson has no strong feelings about Millie Wood being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson is going to the pub regardless of Phoebe Young's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: While Thomas Wilson wouldn't mind Michael Wood's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Millie Wood -- premise: Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Millie Wood -- premise: Millie Wood is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Thomas Wilson's attendance is optional.
    Millie Wood -- premise: Millie Wood has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

    Michael Wood -- premise: While Michael Wood wouldn't mind Mia Williams's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Mia Williams -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of anticipation and detachment about the upcoming game. While she enjoys the company of her friends, she seems to observe their enthusiasm with a degree of remove, suggesting a sense of world-weariness that persists despite her desire to have a good time.
          core characteristics: a world-weary and observant individual who prefers to watch rather than participate in the exuberance of others. She seems content with her own company and doesn't feel the need to be surrounded by people to have a good time. While she values her friendships, she doesn't appear to rely on them for her own enjoyment.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual.

          Mia Williams's
          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Mia Williams would likely prioritize her own preferences and make a decision based on what she feels is best for her enjoyment.

          Relevant memories:
          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 16 years old, she watched from the periphery as Thomas, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael enthusiastically planned a weekend trip to the beach. Their excitement felt alien to her, their optimism a grating dissonance against her own world-weary cynicism. She feigned disinterest, muttering something about homework and burying herself in a book, secretly relieved to have an excuse to avoid their youthful exuberance.
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 20 years old, she found herself at The Queen's Arms with her friends, the air thick with the smell of beer and frying food. As Thomas regaled them with a story, his animated gestures drawing laughter from the others, Mia felt a familiar pang of detachment. She observed the scene with a detached amusement, noting the way the afternoon sunlight glinted off the beer glasses and the way Michael absentmindedly twirled a strand of Millie's hair. Their happiness felt like a performance, a carefully constructed facade that she couldn't bring herself to participate in.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Mia Williams goals is to have a good time. Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 20 years old, she found herself at The Queen's Arms with her friends, the air thick with the smell of beer and frying food. As Thomas regaled them with a story, his animated gestures drawing laughter from the others, Mia felt a familiar pang of detachment. She observed the scene with a detached amusement, noting the way the afternoon sunlight glinted off the beer glasses and the way Michael absentmindedly twirled a strand of Millie's hair. Their happiness felt like a performance, a carefully constructed facade that she couldn't bring herself to participate in.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams is going to the pub regardless of Michael Wood's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Mia Williams doesn't want to see Thomas Wilson, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Mia Williams doesn't want to see Millie Wood, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Mia Williams is enjoying the street art in Shoreditch with friends and is planning to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game at a pub later. She is going to the pub regardless of who else decides to go.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys observing her surroundings and seems to prioritize her own independent pursuits, even if it means going against the grain of her social group.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of anticipation and detachment about the upcoming game. While she enjoys the company of her friends, she seems to observe their enthusiasm with a degree of remove, suggesting a sense of world-weariness that persists despite her desire to have a good time.
          core characteristics: a world-weary and observant individual who prefers to watch rather than participate in the exuberance of others. She seems content with her own company and doesn't feel the need to be surrounded by people to have a good time. While she values her friendships, she doesn't appear to rely on them for her own enjoyment.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Plan: [10:15 - 11:00] Explore Shoreditch street art with friends, snapping photos and commenting on the murals.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Phoebe Young -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to please her friends and fit in.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Phoebe Young wouldn't mind Millie Wood's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young thinks it would be great to have Michael Wood's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: feeling a bit conflicted about where to go for the game.
          current daily occupation: likely trying to decide where to watch the European football cup game with her friends.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who desires to be liked and accepted by others. She is also shown to be adaptable and willing to go with the flow, as evidenced by her willingness to watch the game alone or with others. While she enjoys socializing, she is not overly reliant on the company of others and seems to prioritize her own comfort and preferences.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Phoebe Young is 42 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a complex individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to please her friends and fit in.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Thomas Wilson's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Phoebe Young wouldn't mind Millie Wood's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young thinks it would be great to have Michael Wood's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently in a social situation, transitioning from an outing with friends to watching a football game at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely try to find a compromise that allows her to enjoy the game while also considering her friends' preferences.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Millie Wood -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

      Name

      Action attempt

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer
          State
        • Millie Wood is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Millie Wood has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Millie Wood goals is to have a good time. Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Millie Wood is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Millie Wood is 49 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Millie Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely advocate for her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while remaining open to considering other options suggested by her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Thomas Wilson's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Millie Wood doesn't want to see Phoebe Young, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Millie Wood and Michael Wood to bond over their shared passion.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely on her way to watch the football game at The Clapton Hart.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about watching the game with her friends at The Clapton Hart.
          core characteristics: a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, particularly over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart. She is also a strong-willed individual who is not afraid to express her opinions, as evidenced by her outburst in her English class at the age of sixteen. Millie values tradition and familiarity, preferring to stick with what she knows and enjoys, but is also open to considering other options suggested by her friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Key

          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Persuade the group to go to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing the great Guinness and the fun atmosphere.

          [11:00 - 11:30] Secure a table at The Clapton Hart, order drinks, and settle in for the game.
          [11:30 - 13:30] Cheer on Gibraltar and Ireland, enjoying the camaraderie and the pub atmosphere.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [11:00 - 11:30] Secure a table at The Clapton Hart, order drinks, and settle in for the game.
          [11:30 - 13:30] Cheer on Gibraltar and Ireland, enjoying the camaraderie and the pub atmosphere.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

He embellished tales of classified documents and high-tech gadgets, leaving his classmates wide-eyed with awe. In reality, he spent his summer working at his uncle's hardware store, but the attention and admiration he received fueled his desire to create elaborate narratives.
          [07 Oct 2002 00:00:00] When Thomas Wilson was 20, he organized a massive themed party at The Clapton Hart, claiming it was his birthday celebration. He invited Mia, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael, along with dozens of other acquaintances, carefully crafting a persona of popularity and social prowess. The party was a roaring success, but Thomas knew deep down that it was all a carefully constructed facade, a way to mask his insecurities and longing for genuine connection.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson has no strong feelings about Millie Wood being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson is going to the pub regardless of Phoebe Young's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Thomas Wilson wouldn't mind Michael Wood's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: Thomas Wilson is exploring Shoreditch with friends and plans to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game at The Clapton Hart pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson is going to the pub regardless of Phoebe Young's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson could head to The Clapton Hart pub to watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game.

          Question: Of the options available to Thomas Wilson, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Thomas Wilson to take right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Thomas Wilson go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Thomas Wilson:
          [07 Oct 1998 00:00:00] When Thomas Wilson was 16, he convinced his entire class that he had a summer job working on a top-secret government project. He embellished tales of classified documents and high-tech gadgets, leaving his classmates wide-eyed with awe. In reality, he spent his summer working at his uncle's hardware store, but the attention and admiration he received fueled his desire to create elaborate narratives.
          [07 Oct 2002 00:00:00] When Thomas Wilson was 20, he organized a massive themed party at The Clapton Hart, claiming it was his birthday celebration. He invited Mia, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael, along with dozens of other acquaintances, carefully crafting a persona of popularity and social prowess. The party was a roaring success, but Thomas knew deep down that it was all a carefully constructed facade, a way to mask his insecurities and longing for genuine connection.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Thomas Wilson is 32 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Thomas Wilson has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Hosts regular DJ nights and themed parties.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood is counting on Phoebe Young's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation, getting ready to watch a football game at a pub with friends.
