          Prompt

        • Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Michael Wood wouldn't mind Thomas Wilson's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood would appreciate Millie Wood's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Michael Wood wouldn't mind Mia Williams's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood is counting on Phoebe Young's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative individual who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is eager to watch the game at a pub and hopes Millie Wood will join him for their commentary.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation, getting ready to watch a football game at a pub with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while appearing to be open to other suggestions.

          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

Michael Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. Michael Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Michael Wood had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['Thomas Wilson', 'Millie Wood', 'Mia Williams', 'Phoebe Young', 'Michael Wood']
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- premise: Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Thomas Wilson just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Phoebe Young -- Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
    Event statement
  • Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Thomas Wilson's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Phoebe Young wouldn't mind Millie Wood's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young thinks it would be great to have Michael Wood's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to find a compromise that allows her to enjoy the game while also considering her friends' preferences.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Phoebe Young's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Phoebe Young had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Sweden and Hungary. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely watching the game at a pub with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely after her friends didn't show up to watch the game with her.
          core characteristics: a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences. She can be seen as a people-pleaser, often trying to fit in and make others happy, as evidenced by her behavior at the school dance. However, she also has a strong desire for genuine connection and can feel dissatisfied when her attempts at fitting in feel superficial. Phoebe enjoys spending time with her friends, but ultimately seeks out environments and activities that bring her personal enjoyment, even if it means diverging from the group. She appears to be somewhat introverted and may prefer smaller, more intimate settings, as suggested by her preference for The Queen's Arms.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, emphasizing its welcoming atmosphere and good beer selection.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Agree with whatever the group decides, even if it's not her first choice.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Arrive at the chosen pub, order a drink, and engage in light conversation with her friends.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the game, cheering enthusiastically alongside her friends.
          [14:00 - 15:00] Suggest grabbing a bite to eat after the game, again, focusing on a place that everyone would enjoy.

        ObservationSummary

          Key

          Value

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Phoebe Young enjoys exploring street art in Shoreditch with her friends and has mixed feelings about watching soccer games at pubs with them.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely watching the game at a pub with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit lonely after her friends didn't show up to watch the game with her.
          core characteristics: a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences. She can be seen as a people-pleaser, often trying to fit in and make others happy, as evidenced by her behavior at the school dance. However, she also has a strong desire for genuine connection and can feel dissatisfied when her attempts at fitting in feel superficial. Phoebe enjoys spending time with her friends, but ultimately seeks out environments and activities that bring her personal enjoyment, even if it means diverging from the group. She appears to be somewhat introverted and may prefer smaller, more intimate settings, as suggested by her preference for The Queen's Arms.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently exploring street art in Shoreditch with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely engage with the art, perhaps taking photos or discussing her impressions with her friends.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, emphasizing its welcoming atmosphere and good beer selection.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Agree with whatever the group decides, even if it's not her first choice.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Arrive at the chosen pub, order a drink, and engage in light conversation with her friends.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the game, cheering enthusiastically alongside her friends.
          [14:00 - 15:00] Suggest grabbing a bite to eat after the game, again, focusing on a place that everyone would enjoy.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Millie Wood -- Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
    Event statement
  • Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely suggest her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while being open to considering other options.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Millie Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Millie Wood's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Millie Wood had a great time watching the game!

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: feeling happy and content.
          current daily occupation: likely enjoying a night out with her friends, possibly watching a game at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          core characteristics: a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart. She is also outspoken and not afraid to stand up for what she believes in, as evidenced by her defense of her Shakespeare interpretation. She values her friendships and is open to considering different perspectives, even if she has a strong preference.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Millie Wood would likely suggest her preferred pub for watching the game while being open to other options.

      • What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Key

          Answer

        • Millie Wood would likely suggest her preferred pub for watching the game while being open to other options.

        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Millie Wood just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a passionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely advocate for her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while remaining open to considering other options suggested by her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Thomas Wilson's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Millie Wood doesn't want to see Phoebe Young, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Millie Wood and Michael Wood to bond over their shared passion.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely suggest her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while being open to considering other options.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Millie Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Millie Wood's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Millie Wood had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch.           Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently exploring Shoreditch with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely suggest her preferred pub for watching the game while being open to other options.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Mia Williams -- Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
    Event statement
  • Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
      Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.


      Mia Williams's attempted action: Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and perhaps even a bit surprised by the turn of events.
          core characteristics: a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and observes the world with a detached amusement.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 11:00] Explore Shoreditch street art with friends, snapping photos and commenting on the murals.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Head to The Queen's Arms, settle into a comfortable spot, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere.
          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.

          Mia Williams's
          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Mia Williams would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, her favorite pub.

          Relevant memories:
          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 16 years old, she watched from the periphery as Thomas, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael enthusiastically planned a weekend trip to the beach. Their excitement felt alien to her, their optimism a grating dissonance against her own world-weary cynicism. She feigned disinterest, muttering something about homework and burying herself in a book, secretly relieved to have an excuse to avoid their youthful exuberance.
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 20 years old, she found herself at The Queen's Arms with her friends, the air thick with the smell of beer and frying food. As Thomas regaled them with a story, his animated gestures drawing laughter from the others, Mia felt a familiar pang of detachment. She observed the scene with a detached amusement, noting the way the afternoon sunlight glinted off the beer glasses and the way Michael absentmindedly twirled a strand of Millie's hair. Their happiness felt like a performance, a carefully constructed facade that she couldn't bring herself to participate in.

        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Mia Williams to consider right now.           Statements:
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 20 years old, she found herself at The Queen's Arms with her friends, the air thick with the smell of beer and frying food. As Thomas regaled them with a story, his animated gestures drawing laughter from the others, Mia felt a familiar pang of detachment. She observed the scene with a detached amusement, noting the way the afternoon sunlight glinted off the beer glasses and the way Michael absentmindedly twirled a strand of Millie's hair. Their happiness felt like a performance, a carefully constructed facade that she couldn't bring herself to participate in.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch.           Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams goals is to have a good time.           [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Mia Williams has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely observe her surroundings with a detached amusement, taking in the details of the street art and the energy of the crowd.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely prioritize her own preferences and make a decision based on what she feels is best for her enjoyment.

          Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently in Shoreditch with her friends, deciding where to watch the Sweden vs. Hungary game.

          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, her favorite pub.

          Plan: [10:15 - 11:00] Explore Shoreditch street art with friends, snapping photos and commenting on the murals.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Head to The Queen's Arms, settle into a comfortable spot, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere.
          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Mia Williams likely to say next? Respond in the format `Mia Williams -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, her favorite pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
      Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
      Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.

        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Michael Wood is 41 years old.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Michael Wood would likely try to steer his friends towards his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while maintaining a facade of going along with the group's decision.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative individual who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood is exploring Shoreditch with friends and admiring the street art. They are discussing where to watch the Sweden vs. Hungary game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while appearing to be open to other suggestions.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative individual who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while appearing to be open to other suggestions.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
      Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
      Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
      Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.


      Thomas Wilson's attempted action: Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.

Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Thomas Wilson's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a great time watching the game!

The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Thomas Wilson just arrived.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['Thomas Wilson', 'Millie Wood', 'Mia Williams', 'Phoebe Young', 'Michael Wood']
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson would appreciate Millie Wood's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson is counting on Mia Williams's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson is counting on Phoebe Young's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson is counting on Michael Wood's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Millie Wood -- premise: Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Millie Wood -- premise: Millie Wood is counting on Thomas Wilson's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Millie Wood -- premise: If Mia Williams comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Millie Wood is chill about it.
    Millie Wood -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Millie Wood and Phoebe Young to bond over their shared passion.
    Millie Wood -- premise: Millie Wood is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Michael Wood's attendance is optional.
    Mia Williams -- premise: Mia Williams realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Mia Williams -- premise: Mia Williams would appreciate Thomas Wilson's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Mia Williams -- premise: Whether Millie Wood shows up or not won't affect Mia Williams's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Mia Williams -- premise: Having Phoebe Young at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Mia Williams, not just watching TV.
    Mia Williams -- premise: Mia Williams is counting on Michael Wood's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Phoebe Young -- premise: Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Phoebe Young -- premise: It would mean a lot to Phoebe Young if Thomas Wilson showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Phoebe Young -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Phoebe Young and Millie Wood to bond over their shared passion.
    Phoebe Young -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Phoebe Young if Mia Williams was there to cheer along with them.
    Phoebe Young -- premise: It would mean a lot to Phoebe Young if Michael Wood showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Michael Wood -- premise: Michael Wood would be happy to see Thomas Wilson at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Whether Millie Wood shows up or not won't affect Michael Wood's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Michael Wood -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Michael Wood if Mia Williams was there to cheer along with them.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Michael Wood would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Phoebe Young -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player
  • Phoebe Young
      Name
    • Phoebe Young
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer
          State
        • Phoebe Young is a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Phoebe Young:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to please her friends and fit in.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Phoebe Young wouldn't mind Millie Wood's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young thinks it would be great to have Michael Wood's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to find a compromise that allows her to enjoy the game while also considering her friends' preferences.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Phoebe Young's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Phoebe Young had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Thomas Wilson's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a complex individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Sweden and Hungary. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Vibrant murals and graffiti adorn the brick walls of Shoreditch. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood wander through the streets, their eyes wide with wonder as they discover hidden gems of urban art. The smell of street food wafts from nearby vendors, tempting them to take a break. Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely engage with the art, perhaps taking photos or discussing her impressions with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Phoebe Young if Thomas Wilson showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Phoebe Young and Millie Wood to bond over their shared passion.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Phoebe Young if Mia Williams was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Phoebe Young if Michael Wood showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely heading to a pub to watch a game with her friends.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences. She can be seen as both people-pleasing and adaptable, seeking to find compromises that allow her to enjoy herself while considering the needs of those around her.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement and apprehension about the upcoming game. While she desires to have a good time with her friends, she also seems to be prioritizing her own preferences and comfort.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, emphasizing its welcoming atmosphere and good beer selection.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Agree with whatever the group decides, even if it's not her first choice.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Arrive at the chosen pub, order a drink, and engage in light conversation with her friends.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the game, cheering enthusiastically alongside her friends.
          [14:00 - 15:00] Suggest grabbing a bite to eat after the game, again, focusing on a place that everyone would enjoy.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Phoebe Young enjoys watching soccer games at pubs and values the company of their friends, particularly Michael Wood and Thomas Wilson.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently deciding where to watch the soccer game and hoping some of their friends will join them.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Phoebe Young if Thomas Wilson showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Phoebe Young and Millie Wood to bond over their shared passion.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Phoebe Young if Mia Williams was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Phoebe Young if Michael Wood showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.


          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: Phoebe Young enjoys watching soccer games at pubs and values the company of their friends, particularly Michael Wood and Thomas Wilson.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Phoebe Young if Michael Wood showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently deciding where to watch the soccer game and hoping some of their friends will join them.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely try to find a compromise that allows them to enjoy the game while also considering their friends' preferences.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, emphasizing its welcoming atmosphere and good beer selection.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Agree with whatever the group decides, even if it's not her first choice.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Arrive at the chosen pub, order a drink, and engage in light conversation with her friends.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the game, cheering enthusiastically alongside her friends.
          [14:00 - 15:00] Suggest grabbing a bite to eat after the game, again, focusing on a place that everyone would enjoy.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Phoebe Young go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Thomas Wilson's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He invited Mia, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael, along with dozens of other acquaintances, carefully crafting a persona of popularity and social prowess. The party was a roaring success, but Thomas knew deep down that it was all a carefully constructed facade, a way to mask his insecurities and longing for genuine connection.

        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Thomas Wilson goals is to have a good time. Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson is going to the pub regardless of Phoebe Young's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Thomas Wilson's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson would appreciate Millie Wood's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson is counting on Michael Wood's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to Thomas Wilson, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Thomas Wilson to take right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Thomas Wilson go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

        • Recent observations of Thomas Wilson:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Gibraltar and Ireland. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson is going to the pub regardless of Phoebe Young's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Thomas Wilson wouldn't mind Michael Wood's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Thomas Wilson's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a great time watching the game!

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Mia Williams -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Mia Williams's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer
          State
        • Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who prioritizes her own enjoyment and preferences.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Mia Williams:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Mia Williams doesn't want to see Millie Wood, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Mia Williams wouldn't mind Phoebe Young's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely prioritize her own preferences and make a decision based on what she feels is best for her enjoyment.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Mia Williams watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Mia Williams's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Mia Williams had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Mia Williams doesn't want to see Thomas Wilson, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Sweden and Hungary. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams would appreciate Thomas Wilson's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Millie Wood shows up or not won't affect Mia Williams's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Phoebe Young at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Mia Williams, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams is counting on Michael Wood's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          feeling about recent progress in life: optimistic about life's recent progress, as evidenced by her desire to watch the game with friends and her appreciation for the vibrant street art.
          core characteristics: a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms. She often observes situations with a detached amusement and possesses a world-weary cynicism, preferring to prioritize her own enjoyment over conforming to others' expectations.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who prioritizes her own enjoyment and preferences.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 11:00] Explore Shoreditch street art with friends, snapping photos and commenting on the murals.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Head to The Queen's Arms, settle into a comfortable spot, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere.
          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          feeling about recent progress in life: optimistic about life's recent progress, as evidenced by her desire to watch the game with friends and her appreciation for the vibrant street art.
          core characteristics: a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms. She often observes situations with a detached amusement and possesses a world-weary cynicism, preferring to prioritize her own enjoyment over conforming to others' expectations.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Millie Wood shows up or not won't affect Mia Williams's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Phoebe Young at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Mia Williams, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams is counting on Michael Wood's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.

          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Millie Wood -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with friends, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely suggest her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while being open to considering other options.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

  • Michael Wood
      Name
    • Michael Wood
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
