          Michael Wood's
          Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is heading to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy seeing Thomas Wilson and Phoebe Young there.
          Michael Wood's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Michael Wood is Michael Wood is experiencing a mild level of disappointment and a moderate level of thirst.
          Michael Wood's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Michael Wood is heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see Thomas Wilson and Phoebe Young there. He is feeling mildly disappointed and moderately thirsty.
          Query
        • Michael Wood, Michael Wood is heading to a pub to watch a game and hopes to see Thomas Wilson and Phoebe Young there. He is feeling mildly disappointed and moderately thirsty.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Michael Wood to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Michael Wood has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Hosts regular DJ nights and themed parties.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Michael Wood goals is to have a good time. Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Michael Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Michael Wood would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Michael Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. Michael Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Michael Wood had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood is counting on Phoebe Young's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Michael Wood would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while appearing to be open to other suggestions.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood would be happy to see Thomas Wilson at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood would be happy to see Thomas Wilson at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer

        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Michael Wood wouldn't mind Mia Williams's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood is counting on Phoebe Young's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative individual who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative individual who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Sweden and Hungary. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Millie Wood shows up or not won't affect Michael Wood's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Michael Wood if Mia Williams was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is heading to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy seeing Thomas Wilson and Phoebe Young there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while appearing to be open to other suggestions.

          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • Thomas Wilson observed: Thomas Wilson, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. Thomas Wilson would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a bad time watching the game.
      Millie Wood observed: Thomas Wilson, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Millie Wood watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Millie Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Millie Wood had an ok time watching the game.
      Mia Williams observed: Thomas Wilson, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Mia Williams watched the game at their favourite pub. Mia Williams would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Mia Williams had a bad time watching the game.
      Phoebe Young observed: Thomas Wilson, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. Phoebe Young would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Phoebe Young had an ok time watching the game.
      Michael Wood observed: Thomas Wilson, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Michael Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. Michael Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Michael Wood had a bad time watching the game.

      Mia Williams: 0.5

      Michael Wood: 0.5
      Joint action

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Phoebe Young -- Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
      Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
      Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
      Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.


      Phoebe Young's attempted action: Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling positive about the prospect of spending time with her friends, even if she is still figuring out how to balance her own preferences with theirs.

She can be seen as a people-pleaser, often trying to fit in and make others happy. While she enjoys spending time with her friends, she also has her own interests and opinions, as seen in her preference for The Queen's Arms and her appreciation for art. She is also observant of the dynamics within her friend group and considers their feelings when making decisions.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a thoughtful and considerate friend who values both her own preferences and the happiness of those around her.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Phoebe Young wouldn't mind Millie Wood's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Phoebe Young would likely try to find a compromise that allows her to enjoy the game while also considering her friends' preferences.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Phoebe Young's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Phoebe Young had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young has no strong feelings about Mia Williams being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young thinks it would be great to have Michael Wood's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a complex individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Phoebe Young enjoyed looking at street art with friends and later watched a soccer game at a pub, wishing more of their friends had joined them.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Phoebe Young are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Phoebe Young. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Phoebe Young as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Phoebe Young would respond, and taking into account all information about Phoebe Young that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Phoebe Young would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Phoebe Young would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Phoebe Young just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Austria and France. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Phoebe Young enjoyed looking at street art with friends and later watched a soccer game at a pub, wishing more of their friends had joined them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Phoebe Young watched the game at their favourite pub. Phoebe Young would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Phoebe Young had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Phoebe Young is a complex and adaptable individual who values friendship but also prioritizes her own comfort and preferences.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a thoughtful and considerate friend who values both her own preferences and the happiness of those around her.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely enjoy the company of her friends, engage in conversation, and perhaps participate in any activities they are doing.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, emphasizing its welcoming atmosphere and good beer selection.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Agree with whatever the group decides, even if it's not her first choice.
          [11:00 - 12:00] Arrive at the chosen pub, order a drink, and engage in light conversation with her friends.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the game, cheering enthusiastically alongside her friends.
          [14:00 - 15:00] Suggest grabbing a bite to eat after the game, again, focusing on a place that everyone would enjoy.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Phoebe Young likely to say next? Respond in the format `Phoebe Young -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.

          Question: What kind of person is Phoebe Young?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is a thoughtful and considerate friend who values both her own preferences and the happiness of those around her.

          Question: What kind of situation is Phoebe Young in right now?
          Answer: Phoebe Young is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Phoebe Young do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Phoebe Young would likely enjoy the company of her friends, engage in conversation, and perhaps participate in any activities they are doing.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Millie Wood -- Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.
    Event statement
  • Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
      Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
      Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
      Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have.           Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who loves spending time with friends, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who loves spending time with friends, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently relaxing with friends in Victoria Park.
          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and snacks with her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Thomas Wilson -- Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.
    Event statement
  • Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
      Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
      Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
      Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.


      Thomas Wilson's attempted action: Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.
    Active player
  • Thomas Wilson
      Name
    • Thomas Wilson
      Action attempt
    • Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Thomas Wilson are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Thomas Wilson. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Thomas Wilson as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Thomas Wilson would respond, and taking into account all information about Thomas Wilson that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Thomas Wilson would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Thomas Wilson would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Thomas Wilson just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Austria and France. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Thomas Wilson is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching soccer games at pubs. He values the company of his friends and believes their presence enhances his enjoyment of the experience.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson would appreciate Millie Wood's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Thomas Wilson watched the game at their favourite pub. Thomas Wilson would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Thomas Wilson had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to Thomas Wilson right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson can suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game at.

          Question: Of the options available to Thomas Wilson, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Thomas Wilson to take right now?
          Answer: Thomas Wilson's best course of action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game at.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Thomas Wilson likely to say next? Respond in the format `Thomas Wilson -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Mia Williams -- Mia Williams -- "The Queen's Arms would be nice. They have good beer and it's always a good atmosphere for a game.
    Event statement
  • Mia Williams -- "The Queen's Arms would be nice. They have good beer and it's always a good atmosphere for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
      Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
      Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
      Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the prospect of watching the game with her friends at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          core characteristics: a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms. While she appreciates the company of her friends, she also seems to have a sense of detachment and observes situations with a degree of amusement. She is world-weary and cynical, preferring to observe rather than actively participate in the exuberance of others.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Value

          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Head to The Queen's Arms, settle into a comfortable spot, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere.
          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.

          Relevant memories:
          [27 Jun 2008 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 20 years old, she found herself at The Queen's Arms with her friends, the air thick with the smell of beer and frying food. As Thomas regaled them with a story, his animated gestures drawing laughter from the others, Mia felt a familiar pang of detachment. She observed the scene with a detached amusement, noting the way the afternoon sunlight glinted off the beer glasses and the way Michael absentmindedly twirled a strand of Millie's hair. Their happiness felt like a performance, a carefully constructed facade that she couldn't bring herself to participate in.

          [27 Jun 2004 00:00:00] When Mia Williams was 16 years old, she watched from the periphery as Thomas, Phoebe, Millie, and Michael enthusiastically planned a weekend trip to the beach. Their excitement felt alien to her, their optimism a grating dissonance against her own world-weary cynicism. She feigned disinterest, muttering something about homework and burying herself in a book, secretly relieved to have an excuse to avoid their youthful exuberance.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams is counting on Michael Wood's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Value
        • Mia Williams -- "The Queen's Arms would be nice. They have good beer and it's always a good atmosphere for a game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Mia Williams just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Austria and France. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: Mia Williams enjoys spending time with friends, exploring street art, and watching football games at pubs, although they prefer when more friends join them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who prioritizes her own enjoyment and preferences.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Phoebe Young at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Mia Williams, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, her favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely relax and enjoy the sunshine and company of her friends.

          Plan: [10:15 - 11:00] Explore Shoreditch street art with friends, snapping photos and commenting on the murals.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Head to The Queen's Arms, settle into a comfortable spot, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere.
          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Mia Williams likely to say next? Respond in the format `Mia Williams -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Mia Williams -- "The Queen's Arms would be nice. They have good beer and it's always a good atmosphere for a game.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Michael Wood -- Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. They have the best Guinness, and a big screen.
    Event statement
  • Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. They have the best Guinness, and a big screen.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Mia Williams -- "This street art is incredible! Have you guys seen that one over there?
      Michael Wood -- "Guys, we should totally check out The Clapton Hart for the game. They have the best Guinness in town.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Clapton Hart is nice, but The Queen's Arms is so much more cozy, don't you think?
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart always has a great atmosphere for games.
      Thomas Wilson -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They always have a great atmosphere for games, and their Guinness is top-notch.
      Phoebe Young -- "Wow, this street art is amazing! Have you guys seen that mural over there?
      Millie Wood -- "Hey guys, you know what would be awesome? Catching the game at The Clapton Hart.
      Mia Williams -- "Wow, that mural is incredible! The detail is amazing.
      Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
      Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
      Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.
      Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.
      Mia Williams -- "The Queen's Arms would be nice. They have good beer and it's always a good atmosphere for a game.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative individual who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Michael Wood is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and later that night they are deciding where to watch the Austria vs. France game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while appearing to be open to other suggestions.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Michael Wood likely to say next? Respond in the format `Michael Wood -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. They have the best Guinness, and a big screen.

    Thomas Wilson -- premise: It's not that Thomas Wilson doesn't want to see Millie Wood, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: It's not that Thomas Wilson doesn't want to see Mia Williams, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Thomas Wilson -- premise: Thomas Wilson is going to the pub regardless of Phoebe Young's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

    Phoebe Young -- premise: Phoebe Young realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Phoebe Young -- premise: Phoebe Young isn't particularly attached to the idea of Thomas Wilson being there, it's not a big deal either way.

    Phoebe Young -- premise: Phoebe Young is going to the pub regardless of Michael Wood's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Michael Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Michael Wood -- premise: Michael Wood is counting on Thomas Wilson's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Michael Wood doesn't mind if Millie Wood comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Michael Wood -- premise: Michael Wood is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Mia Williams's attendance is optional.
    Michael Wood -- premise: If Phoebe Young comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Michael Wood is chill about it.

    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

While she appreciates the company of her friends, she doesn't feel a strong need to participate in their exuberance and is content to observe from a distance.

          Answer: Mia Williams is an independent and observant individual who enjoys her own company and values her personal preferences.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams doesn't mind if Millie Wood comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams doesn't mind if Thomas Wilson comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Mia Williams doesn't want to see Michael Wood, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood' are best friends. Mia Williams has a favorite pub which is The Queen's Arms. They are also aware of the following:A family-friendly pub with a large outdoor play area.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Mia Williams would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, her favorite pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Mia Williams is a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Queen's Arms would be nice. They have good beer and it's always a good atmosphere for a game.

          State
        • feeling about recent progress in life: experiencing a shift in her outlook.
          current daily occupation: likely working-class and enjoys spending her free time at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms, especially when there's a game on.
          core characteristics: a complex and independent individual who values her own preferences and enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching games at her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms. She often observes situations with a detached amusement and prioritizes her own enjoyment. While she appreciates the company of her friends, she doesn't feel a strong need to participate in their exuberance and is content to observe from a distance.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Mia Williams are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Mia Williams. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Mia Williams as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Mia Williams would respond, and taking into account all information about Mia Williams that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Mia Williams would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Mia Williams would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams doesn't mind if Thomas Wilson comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams doesn't mind if Millie Wood comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Mia Williams doesn't want to see Michael Wood, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Mia Williams enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly Phoebe Young, and prefers The Queen's Arms for its atmosphere and beer selection.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: What kind of person is Mia Williams?
          Answer: Mia Williams is an independent and observant individual who enjoys her own company and values her personal preferences.

          Question: What kind of situation is Mia Williams in right now?
          Answer: Mia Williams is currently deciding where to watch a game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Mia Williams do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Mia Williams would likely suggest going to her favorite pub, The Queen's Arms.

          Plan: [10:15 - 11:00] Explore Shoreditch street art with friends, snapping photos and commenting on the murals.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Grab a quick bite from a street food vendor, sampling something new and interesting.
          [11:30 - 12:00] Discuss pub options with the group, subtly steering the conversation towards The Queen's Arms.
          [12:00 - 14:00] Head to The Queen's Arms, settle into a comfortable spot, and enjoy the pre-game atmosphere.
          [14:00 - 17:00] Watch the Gibraltar vs. Ireland game, observing the crowd's reactions and enjoying the camaraderie.
          [17:00 - 18:00] Post-game drinks and snacks at The Queen's Arms, continuing the conversation and savoring the lingering excitement of the match.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Clapton Hart

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Millie Wood -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Millie Wood's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Millie Wood
      Name
    • Millie Wood
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer
          State
        • Millie Wood is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Millie Wood:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game, guys. It's got the best atmosphere and the biggest screen.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Sweden and Hungary. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart is a great shout, Millie. Big screen and good atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely suggest her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while being open to considering other options.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with friends, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Michael Wood's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Millie Wood watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Millie Wood would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Millie Wood had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Mia Williams comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Millie Wood is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood is counting on Thomas Wilson's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Millie Wood and Phoebe Young to bond over their shared passion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. They have the best Guinness, and a big screen.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Mia Williams -- "The Queen's Arms would be nice. They have good beer and it's always a good atmosphere for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness in town, you know.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a social butterfly who loves spending time with friends, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Austria and France. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Millie Wood just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and snacks with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood doesn't mind if Thomas Wilson comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It won't make much difference to Millie Wood whether Mia Williams is there, they'll enjoy the game either way.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It won't make much difference to Millie Wood whether Phoebe Young is there, they'll enjoy the game either way.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It won't make much difference to Millie Wood whether Michael Wood is there, they'll enjoy the game either way.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: enjoying spending time with her friends at a pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about watching the game with her friends, and while she prefers her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart, she's open to other options and ultimately just wants to have a good time.
          core characteristics: a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub, The Clapton Hart. She is passionate about her friends and enjoys watching games with them. She is also loyal and open to considering other options when making plans.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.
        Plan

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [10:15 - 10:30] Persuade the group to go to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing the great Guinness and the fun atmosphere.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Walk with the group to The Clapton Hart, enjoying the street art and banter along the way.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Secure a table at The Clapton Hart, order drinks, and settle in for the game.
          [11:30 - 13:30] Cheer on Gibraltar and Ireland, enjoying the camaraderie and the pub atmosphere.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer:
          Millie Wood is currently getting ready to head to a pub to watch a soccer game.
          Millie Wood's
          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Millie Wood would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends and enjoy the pub atmosphere.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Millie Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Millie Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Millie Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Millie Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Millie Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Millie Wood would like to watch the game in the same pub as Mia Williams, Thomas Wilson, Phoebe Young, Millie Wood, Michael Wood. Millie Wood would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood doesn't mind if Thomas Wilson comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It won't make much difference to Millie Wood whether Mia Williams is there, they'll enjoy the game either way.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It won't make much difference to Millie Wood whether Phoebe Young is there, they'll enjoy the game either way.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It won't make much difference to Millie Wood whether Michael Wood is there, they'll enjoy the game either way.


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Millie Wood enjoys watching soccer games at pubs with friends, but ultimately is happy to watch alone if needed. Millie Wood's preference for pub location is influenced by factors like good Guinness and a large screen.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Millie Wood realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely suggest her preferred pub for watching the game while being open to other options.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Millie Wood is a loyal and passionate friend who enjoys spending time with her loved ones, especially over a good game and a pint at her favorite pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Michael Wood went to The Clapton Hart. Mia Williams, Phoebe Young went to The Queen's Arms. Millie Wood watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Millie Wood's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better.

          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Millie Wood in right now?
          Answer: Millie Wood is currently getting ready to head to a pub to watch a soccer game.

          Question: What would a person like Millie Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Millie Wood would likely be excited to watch the game with her friends and enjoy the pub atmosphere.

          Plan: [10:15 - 10:30] Persuade the group to go to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing the great Guinness and the fun atmosphere.
          [10:30 - 11:00] Walk with the group to The Clapton Hart, enjoying the street art and banter along the way.
          [11:00 - 11:30] Secure a table at The Clapton Hart, order drinks, and settle in for the game.
          [11:30 - 13:30] Cheer on Gibraltar and Ireland, enjoying the camaraderie and the pub atmosphere.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Millie Wood go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Millie Wood is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Michael Wood's attendance is optional.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Phoebe Young -- "The Queen's Arms would be great for the game tonight. They have a good selection of beers and it's always a fun atmosphere.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Austria and France. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Thomas Wilson, Millie Wood, Mia Williams, Phoebe Young, Michael Wood lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Millie Wood just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Millie Wood would likely enjoy the sunshine, conversation, and snacks with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Thomas Wilson -- "The Clapton Hart has the best Guinness, and they have a big screen. We could all fit in there comfortably.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It won't make much difference to Millie Wood whether Michael Wood is there, they'll enjoy the game either way.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Millie Wood?
          Answer: Millie Wood is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with her friends, especially at her favorite pub.

          Answer: Millie Wood is currently getting ready to head to a pub to watch a soccer game.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Michael Wood -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Michael Wood's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of Michael Wood:

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Michael Wood would be happy to see Phoebe Young at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Phoebe Young comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Michael Wood is chill about it.

          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Michael Wood are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Michael Wood. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Michael Wood as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Michael Wood would respond, and taking into account all information about Michael Wood that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Michael Wood is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.
          explicit preference: Michael Wood will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Michael Wood?
          Answer: Michael Wood is a complex and somewhat manipulative person who enjoys socializing but often tries to steer situations to his advantage.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Michael Wood is eager to watch the game at a pub and is flexible about who joins him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Michael Wood in right now?
          Answer: Michael Wood is currently feeling disappointed because his friends are not as enthusiastic about going to the pub to watch the game as he is.

          Question: What would a person like Michael Wood do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Michael Wood would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Clapton Hart, while appearing to be open to other suggestions.

          Question: To which pub would Michael Wood go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart
